questions.text: A particular community population has been consuming Maize as a staple diet for years. The vitamin deficiency most likely to be seen in this population is: (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Niacin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Maize as a staple diet leads to niacin deficiency due to its low tryptophan and high leucine content, resulting in pellagra.
  • ➤ Note – Leucine is known as pellagrogenic aminoacid in India
  • ➤ Note – Leucine is known as pellagrogenic aminoacid in India

questions.text: Which anthropometric parameter indicates chronic malnutrition in a child according to WHO growth standards? (FMGE JAN 2025)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Height for age

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Chronic malnutrition is best measured by height-for-age, as it indicates long-term nutritional deficiencies leading to stunting. In contrast, weight-for-height reflects acute malnutrition (wasting), and weight-for-age is a mixed indicator.

questions.text: A 30-year-old woman presents with delayed periods and vaginal bleeding. An ultrasound reveals retained products of conception, and a suction evacuation is performed. The extracted tissue is sent for histopathology, which reports a karyotype of 46XX and is p57kip2 negative. What is the most likely diagnosis? (FMGE JAN 2025)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Complete mole

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ complete molar pregnancy is characterized by:
  • ➤ Diploid karyotype (46XX) Negative p57kip2 staining Complete absence of maternal genetic material
  • ➤ Diploid karyotype (46XX)
  • ➤ Diploid karyotype (46XX)
  • ➤ Negative p57kip2 staining
  • ➤ Negative p57kip2 staining
  • ➤ Complete absence of maternal genetic material
  • ➤ Complete absence of maternal genetic material

questions.text: During starvation, which of the following hormones is primarily produced to maintain blood glucose levels? (FMGE JAN 2025)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Glucagon

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Glucagon is the principal hormone responsible for maintaining blood glucose levels during starvation through activation of glycogenolysis , gluconeogenesis, and lipolysis . Its levels increase while insulin levels decrease during starvation.
  • ➤ activation of glycogenolysis
  • ➤ gluconeogenesis, and lipolysis
  • ➤ Hormonal Regulation During Starvation
  • ➤ Hormonal Regulation During Starvation

questions.text: A patient with anemia and a regular history of blood transfusions since an early age was carrying his daily activities normally. He experiences a mild respiratory infection following which he developed fatigue, severe pallor, and shortness of breath. Which of the following is the likely organism involved? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Parvovirus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Parvovirus B19 is the most common cause of aplastic crisis in patients with chronic hemolytic anemia, such as thalassemia, due to its specific effect on erythroid progenitor cells in the bone marrow.

questions.text: A child was brought to ENT OPD with complaints of mouth breathing and snoring from a long duration. He also asks to increase the volume of TV while watching. What is the best treatment for this child’s condition? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Adenoidectomy and grommet

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In cases of chronic adenoid hypertrophy causing mouth breathing, snoring, and conductive hearing loss, the best treatment involves adenoidectomy along with the insertion of a grommet to ensure proper drainage of middle ear fluid and restore normal hearing.

questions.text: A 7-year-old boy was brought to the hospital with multiple fractures of the humerus secondary to a fall from height. On examination, there is difficulty in flexion of the elbow and supination of the forearm, and associated loss of sensation over the lateral aspect of the forearm. Which nerve is most likely to be injured? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Musculocutaneous nerve

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:

questions.text: A patient presented with fever and abdominal pain. Investigations showed the given findings. Which of the following statements is true regarding this condition? (NEET PG 2023)

options.label: C
options.text: Angioembolization is the treatment of choice

options.label: D
options.text: Echinococcus species is involved in Etiology

questions.correct_answer: D. Echinococcus species is involved in Etiology
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Echinococcus species is involved in Etiology

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hydatid disease of the liver, caused by Echinococcus granulosus, is characterized by the formation of cysts that can be identified using imaging techniques like USG and CECT. The primary treatment approach includes medical management with albendazole followed by the PAIR procedure or surgery if PAIR is not feasible. FNAC is contraindicated due to the risk of cyst rupture and anaphylaxis.
  • ➤ Hydatid disease of the liver, caused by Echinococcus granulosus, is characterized by the formation of cysts that can be identified using imaging techniques like USG and CECT.
  • ➤ The primary treatment approach includes medical management with albendazole followed by the PAIR procedure or surgery if PAIR is not feasible.
  • ➤ FNAC is contraindicated due to the risk of cyst rupture and anaphylaxis.

questions.text: In a patient with electrical burns and stable vital signs, red-coloured urine is observed with increased levels of creatinine kinase. Which of the following is a likely finding in the patient’s examination? (FMGE JAN 2025)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Increased creatinine levels

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Electrical burns can cause myoglobinuria and acute kidney injury, leading to increased creatinine levels.

questions.text: A chronic alcoholic patient presents with lower back pain and fever. She has elevated amylase levels and has experienced similar episodes in the past as well. Which type of necrosis is likely to be present? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Fat necrosis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fat necrosis is a hallmark of pancreatitis, particularly in the context of chronic alcohol use. It is caused by the action of pancreatic enzymes on surrounding fat tissue, leading to saponification and calcium deposition.

questions.text: A patient fell down riding a bicycle. He started having pain around hip. There was shortening of limb, and the attitude of limb was Flexion, Adduction and Internal rotation. What is the diagnosis? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Posterior dislocation of hip

questions.text: G2 at 8 weeks diagnosed to have hyperthyroidism. What is the drug of choice? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Propylthiouracil

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the first trimester of pregnancy, propylthiouracil (PTU) is the drug of choice for hyperthyroidism due to its safer profile compared to other antithyroid medications.

questions.text: An unimmunized 2-year-old child presented with coryza, conjunctivitis, and bluish-white spots in his buccal mucosa near the lower molar teeth. A day later, he developed a maculopapular rash on the face and neck. What is the nature of the causative virus? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Enveloped ss RNA

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Measles virus is characterized as an enveloped single-stranded RNA virus, notable for the unique clinical presentation of Koplik's spots, which precede the characteristic maculopapular rash. This distinguishing feature is essential for the clinical diagnosis of measles.

questions.text: Identify the given instrument: (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Wire Speculum

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A wire speculum is a key instrument in ophthalmic surgery, used to keep the eyelids open and provide access to the eye during various procedures. Its characteristic wire-like structure with loops at the ends distinguishes it from other lid manipulation instruments.

questions.text: A 24-year-old male with history of intermittent evening rise of temperature and weight loss has presented with a flexion deformity of the right hip. He had occasional low back ache and on examination, there was hyper reflex on knee jerk. Identify the marked structure responsible to be involved in this pathology:(NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation: Ans. D) 4

questions.text: Which of the following represent Median Nerve Entrapment Syndrome? (NEET PG 2017)
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Median nerve entrapment can occur at multiple anatomical locations resulting in distinct clinical syndromes: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome (most common, at wrist), Pronator Syndrome (proximal forearm), and Kiloh-Nevin Syndrome (affecting the Anterior Interosseous branch).

questions.text: The "Hanging Curtain Sign" is observed in which of the following conditions? (NEET PG 2016)
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Pityriasis Rosea.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Hanging Curtain Sign is a characteristic feature of pityriasis rosea where stretching the herald patch causes the collarette scales to fold along the lines of stretch due to their unique attachment pattern with the outer edge attached and inner edge free.
  • ➤ The Hanging Curtain Sign is a characteristic feature of pityriasis rosea where stretching the herald patch causes the collarette scales to fold along the lines of stretch due to their unique attachment pattern with the outer edge attached and inner edge free.
  • ➤ pityriasis rosea
  • ➤ collarette scales
  • ➤ outer edge attached and inner edge free.

questions.text: Which of the following would most likely lead to a decrease in the intensity of the murmur in a patient with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Squatting

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Increasing preload (e.g., through squatting) reduces LVOT obstruction in hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, leading to a decrease in the murmur's intensity.

questions.text: Which condition is characterized by flaccid bullae with mucosal involvement and intraepidermal acantholysis? (NEET PG 2015)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Pemphigus Vulgaris

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pemphigus vulgaris is uniquely characterized by the triad of flaccid bullae , universal mucosal involvement , and suprabasal acantholysis due to anti-desmoglein 3 antibodies , distinguishing it from other vesiculobullous disorders.
  • ➤ Pemphigus vulgaris is uniquely characterized by the triad of flaccid bullae , universal mucosal involvement , and suprabasal acantholysis due to anti-desmoglein 3 antibodies , distinguishing it from other vesiculobullous disorders.
  • ➤ Pemphigus vulgaris
  • ➤ triad of flaccid bullae
  • ➤ mucosal involvement
  • ➤ suprabasal acantholysis
  • ➤ anti-desmoglein 3 antibodies

questions.text: Which of the following method is shown in the surgical procedure to close the abdominal wound with the help of a mesh? (FMGE JULY 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Onlay

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The onlay method involves placing the mesh on top of the abdominal muscles and rectus sheath, commonly used in open ventral hernia repairs.

questions.text: A 30-year-old lady presented with generalized fatigue and lethargy. Her general examination revealed a few superficial lymph nodes in the cervical and axillary regions. Labs – TC: 7400, Hb: 12.8 g/dL, and Platelets: 244,000. She had a normal DC and lymph node biopsy revealed architectural distortion, infiltration with cells with indented nucleus, and prominent nucleolus containing atypical cells. Immunophenotyping showed CD10 and Bcl2 were positive. What is the likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2021)
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Follicular Lymphoma

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Follicular lymphoma often presents with lymphadenopathy and generalized symptoms such as fatigue. Key diagnostic features include CD10 and Bcl2 positivity on immunophenotyping, reflecting its germinal center origin and overexpression of the anti-apoptotic protein Bcl2.

questions.text: Proteoglycan present in glomerular basement membrane?(NEET PG 2020)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Heparan Sulfate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ GAGs (Location and Function)
  • ➤ GAGs (Location and Function)
  • ➤ Ref- Harper 31st ed pg – 602
  • ➤ Ref- Harper 31st ed pg – 602

questions.text: In the jugular venous pressure (JVP) waveform, the a-wave corresponds to: (FMGE JAN 2025)
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Atrial contraction

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The a-wave in the jugular venous pressure (JVP) waveform corresponds to atrial contraction . When the right atrium contracts , it causes an increase in pressure , which is transmitted backward into the jugular veins , creating the a-wave . This wave appears just before the carotid pulse and the first heart sound (S1) .
  • • a-wave
  • • jugular venous pressure (JVP) waveform
  • • atrial contraction
  • • right atrium contracts
  • • increase in pressure
  • • jugular veins
  • • a-wave
  • • appears just before the carotid pulse and the first heart sound (S1)
  • • Other Options:
  • • Other Options:
  • • Option B. Ventricular contraction: Incorrect
  • • Option B. Ventricular contraction:
  • • Ventricular contraction corresponds to the c-wave in the JVP waveform, caused by bulging of the tricuspid valve into the right atrium during isovolumetric ventricular contraction
  • • Ventricular contraction corresponds to the c-wave in the JVP waveform, caused by bulging of the tricuspid valve into the right atrium during isovolumetric ventricular contraction
  • • Ventricular contraction corresponds to the c-wave
  • • bulging of the tricuspid valve into the right atrium during isovolumetric ventricular contraction
  • • Option C. Passive atrial filling: Incorrect
  • • Option C. Passive atrial filling:
  • • Corresponds to the v-wave in the JVP waveform Occurs during ventricular systole when the tricuspid valve is closed and blood continues to flow into the right atrium from the venae cavae
  • • Corresponds to the v-wave in the JVP waveform
  • • Corresponds to the v-wave
  • • Occurs during ventricular systole when the tricuspid valve is closed and blood continues to flow into the right atrium from the venae cavae
  • • Occurs during ventricular systole
  • • tricuspid valve is closed
  • • flow into the right atrium from the venae cavae
  • • Option D. Tricuspid valve closure: Incorrect
  • • Option D. Tricuspid valve closure:
  • • Associated with the c-wave , not a distinct wave of its own
  • • Associated with the c-wave , not a distinct wave of its own
  • • Associated with the c-wave

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The a-wave in the JVP waveform corresponds to atrial contraction and is a key marker of normal atrial function .
  • ➤ a-wave in the JVP waveform
  • ➤ atrial contraction
  • ➤ key marker of normal atrial function

questions.text: A woman comes with complaints of pain and swelling in the perineal area, difficulty in walking and sitting. She has a history of multiple sexual partners. On examination, a tender swelling is seen with redness on the labia, as shown in the image given below. What is the most likely diagnosis? (NEET PG 2023)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Bartholin abscess

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The given clinical scenario and image points to the diagnosis of Bartholin's abscess.
  • • Bartholin Cyst and Abscess
  • • Bartholin gland is a mucus-secreting gland, which plays a role in vaginal lubrication. They are a pair of 0.5 cm glands located in the lower right and left portions at the 4 o’clock and 8 o’clock positions of the vaginal introitus. They are generally nonpalpable when not obstructed.
  • • Pathophysiology: Bartholin glands can form a cyst and an abscess in women of reproductive age and may cause dyspareunia, urinary irritation, and vague pelvic pain.
  • • C/F:
  • • The physical exam will often reveal asymmetry with a protrusion of one side (left or right) of the inferior aspect of the vulva. Bartholin gland abscesses, unlike Bartholin cysts, are very painful. While both are primarily unilateral, Bartholin abscesses are often tender to palpation, erythematous, indurated, and may have an area of fluctuance and/or purulent drainage. Treatment Asymptomatic Bartholin cysts do not require further treatment. Bartholin abscesses may be treated with incision and drainage with Word catheter placement due to ease and effectiveness of treatment. Marsupialization is the procedure of choice. Women with recurrent cysts or those who are post-menopausal (risk of malignancy) should have the cyst completely excised.
  • • The physical exam will often reveal asymmetry with a protrusion of one side (left or right) of the inferior aspect of the vulva.
  • • Bartholin gland abscesses, unlike Bartholin cysts, are very painful.
  • • While both are primarily unilateral, Bartholin abscesses are often tender to palpation, erythematous, indurated, and may have an area of fluctuance and/or purulent drainage.
  • • Treatment
  • • Asymptomatic Bartholin cysts do not require further treatment.
  • • Bartholin abscesses may be treated with incision and drainage with Word catheter placement due to ease and effectiveness of treatment.
  • • Marsupialization is the procedure of choice.
  • • Women with recurrent cysts or those who are post-menopausal (risk of malignancy) should have the cyst completely excised.
  • • Other options:
  • • Other options:
  • • Option A. Chlamydial infection : Chlamydial infection patient usually present with vaginal discharge, dysuria, or cervicitis.
  • • Option A. Chlamydial infection
  • • Option C. Genital tuberculosis : Genital tuberculosis involves the upper genital tract, leading to menstrual irregularities, infertility, and abdominal pain.
  • • Option C. Genital tuberculosis
  • • Option D. Genital herpes : Genital herpes usually presents as painful ulcers or vesicles in the genital area, rather than a tender, erythematous swelling.
  • • Option D. Genital herpes

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A Bartholin abscess presents with significant pain, redness, and swelling in the labia, often making walking and sitting difficult.

questions.text: What is the diagnosis based on the CT image? (NEET PG 2024)
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) PUJO (Pelviureteric Junction Obstruction)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ PUJO is characterized by massive dilation of the renal pelvis with thinning of the renal parenchyma due to obstruction at the pelviureteric junction. The pelvis is more dilated than the calyces, which is a hallmark finding on imaging.
